components.description: One or more scoops of ice cream in a dessert bowl, variously topped with sprinkles, wafer rolls, or cherry and syrup. Flavors vary from vanilla, chocolate, and/or strawberry across platforms.
components.title: Ice Cream

description: One or more scoops of ice cream in a dessert bowl, variously topped with sprinkles, wafer rolls, or cherry and syrup. Flavors vary from vanilla, chocolate, and/or strawberry across platforms.
title: Ice Cream

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Food symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A bowl containing one or more scoops of ice cream. Ice Cream was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Cop http://emojipedia.org/ice-cream/
emoji_net_data.name: ice cream

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00090736v: To liquefy by applying heat; to transform from solid to liquid state.
Reduce or cause to be reduced from a solid to a liquid state, usually by heating
To change (or to be changed) from a solid state to a liquid state, usually by a gradual heat.
Intransitive: to change from a solid to a liquid.

bn:00045722n: Ice cream is a frozen food usually made from dairy products, such as milk and cream and often combined with fruits or other ingredients and flavors.
Frozen dessert containing cream and sugar and flavoring
A cold dessert (made of water, cream and milk, combined with flavourings, emulsifiers and sugar) that's popular when it's hot.
A dessert made from frozen sweetened cream or a similar substance, usually flavoured.

bn:00001880n: A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal
A dish served as the last course of a meal
A usage seen in the United Kingdom and some other Commonwealth countries.
Dessert is a typically sweet course that concludes an evening meal.
A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet course that concludes a meal

bn:00035650n: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.
